```markdown
# is-glob

Returns `true` if the given string looks like a glob pattern or an extglob pattern. This makes it easy to create code that only uses external modules like node-glob when necessary, resulting in much faster code execution and initialization time, and a better user experience.

[![NPM version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/is-glob.svg?style=flat)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/is-glob)
[![NPM monthly downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dm/is-glob.svg?style=flat)](https://npmjs.org/package/is-glob)
[![NPM total downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/is-glob.svg?style=flat)](https://npmjs.org/package/is-glob)
[![Build Status](https://img.shields.io/github/workflow/status/micromatch/is-glob/dev)](https://github.com/micromatch/is-glob/actions)


## Install

```bash
npm install --save is-glob
```

Also consider [is-valid-glob](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/is-valid-glob) and [has-glob](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/has-glob).


## Usage

```javascript
const isGlob = require('is-glob');

```

### Default Behavior

**True**

Glob patterns and extglob patterns return `true`:

```javascript
console.log(isGlob('!foo.js'));  // true
console.log(isGlob('*.js'));   // true
console.log(isGlob('**/abc.js')); // true
console.log(isGlob('abc/*.js')); // true
console.log(isGlob('abc/(aaa|bbb).js')); // true
console.log(isGlob('abc/[a-z].js')); // true
console.log(isGlob('abc/{a,b}.js')); // true
console.log(isGlob('abc/@(a).js')); // true
console.log(isGlob('abc/!(a).js')); // true
console.log(isGlob('abc/+(a).js')); // true
console.log(isGlob('abc/*(a).js')); // true
console.log(isGlob('abc/?(a).js')); // true
```

**False**

Escaped globs, extglobs, and non-glob patterns return `false`:

```javascript
console.log(isGlob('abc/\\@(a).js')); // false
console.log(isGlob('\\!foo.js'));  // false
console.log(isGlob('abc.js')); // false
console.log(isGlob('foo.js'));  // false
console.log(isGlob());  // false
console.log(isGlob(null)); // false
console.log(isGlob(['**/*.js'])); // false
```

### Option `strict`

When `options.strict === false`, the behavior is less strict.  This is useful for libraries like micromatch.

**True (with `strict: false`)**

```javascript
console.log(isGlob('!foo.js', { strict: false })); // true
console.log(isGlob('*.js', { strict: false })); // true
```

**False (with `strict: false`)**

```javascript
console.log(isGlob('\\!foo.js', { strict: false })); // false
```


## About

See the [Contributing](./CONTRIBUTING.md) guide for details on contributing to this project.


## Related projects

* [micromatch](https://github.com/micromatch/micromatch):  Glob matching library that is often used alongside this module.
* [is-valid-glob](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/is-valid-glob):  Validates glob patterns.
* [has-glob](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/has-glob): Checks if an array contains globs.
